error_frame.nogc_enabled:
A gamecard has been inserted, but the "nogc" patch is enabled.
Nothing at all can be done with the inserted gamecard.
Disabling this patch *will* update the Lotus ASIC firmware if it's outdated.
Consider disabling this patch if you wish to use gamecard dumping features.
error_frame.lafw_update_required:
A gamecard has been inserted, but a Lotus ASIC firmware update is required.
Update your console using the inserted gamecard and try again.
error_frame.info_not_loaded:
A gamecard has been inserted, but an unexpected I/O error occurred.
Please report this issue at "{0}".

list.launch_error_info: Please take out the gamecard and reinsert it into the console after exiting nxdumptool to mitigate launch errors.

user_titles.header: Applications available in the inserted gamecard
user_titles.info: To perform operations on the user titles available in this gamecard, please go to the "{0}" menu.

dump_card_image.label: Dump gamecard image (XCI)
dump_card_image.description: Generates a raw gamecard image. This is the option most people will want to use.

dump_certificate.label: Dump gamecard certificate
dump_certificate.description: The gamecard certificate is used to unequivocally identify each individual gamecard.

dump_header.label: Dump gamecard header
dump_header.description:
The gamecard header holds information such as the location of the root HFS partition and the gamecard capacity.
Only useful for developers, preservationists and advanced users.

dump_decrypted_cardinfo.label: Dump decrypted CardInfo area
dump_decrypted_cardinfo.description:
The CardInfo area holds information such as the bundled system update version and the Lotus ASIC firmware version required by the gamecard.
This area is part of the gamecard header, but it's always encrypted.
Only useful for developers, preservationists and advanced users.

dump_initial_data.label: Dump InitialData area
dump_initial_data.description:
The InitialData area holds cryptographic information used by the Lotus ASIC to communicate with the gamecard.
It can't be dumped through normal means - it's not part of the storage areas from gamecard images.
Only useful for developers, preservationists and advanced users.

dump_hfs_partitions.label: Dump Hash File System (HFS) partitions
dump_hfs_partitions.description: Dumps data from the HFS partitions within the gamecard storage areas, in both raw and extracted forms.
